intro: Chrysolinum strictum, commonly known as the slender chrysolinum, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the southern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically display a range of colors from white to pink. Chrysolinum strictum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
